website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy 3-season tent that's ideal for couples and families that go camping often.
pros: Rain fly and water-resistant fabric keep you dry in the worst storms
Easy to pitch and take down
Zippers are sturdy and won't break
cons: May leak if you don't waterproof the tent before use

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TENT
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent if you like Camo or are just camping in the woods. There is lots And lots of space.We were able to fit 2 cots in there with plenty of room in between and Also hooked up my ps4 and monitor IT WAS AWESOME! I also like how you could hang a lantern or flashlight at the top. And how you didn’t have to crouch you can perfectly stand up in the tent. The tarp on the ground was very sturdy and easy to clean. The windows allowed for a lot of air flow which is always good. Overall this tent is amazing and I would recommend you buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Pingel

customer_reviews.title: Tent
customer_reviews.text: Had this tent 3 days before i used it on our hunting trip. Very well made and easy to set up. I like how the rain fly is put together and works great. Second day out it started to rain, i kept checking the tent for leaks and had no water anywhere. Had plenty of room for my queen sized mattress and all my hunting gear. The open top was perfect for venting on the first night but it got EXTREMELY cold the second night. Nothing a MR HEATER can't fix which they all had and i didn't. Will buy one and have for the next trip.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Great tent at a good value
customer_reviews.text: I'm a solo hunter, 6 to 7 days alone and isolated. Did at inspection set up in the backyard looked good and all parts were there. And it did rain that day so it waterproof as advertised can't wait use it this fall
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hefferan

customer_reviews.title: Decent Tent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a summer tent. It works well and is easy to set up. My first trip camping involved 3 days of rain. I had sealed the tent using Grip Seal and it worked well. There were still several places where water came in mainly around the stitching of the floor panel and the sides especially where the corners are sewn. The tent has excellent ventilation, thus I would say this is a two season tent. Overall I like the tent, but seam seal everything, then do it again!
customer_reviews.author: Skipper T

customer_reviews.title: Had this for a few years now and it still holds up!
customer_reviews.text: Used this thing for years and it still works great, easy to set up and holds up pretty well to Florida weather. Really great price and plenty room for a queen size blow up mattress and a single mat right next to it and still some room at the entrance to stand up and change clothes if need be. Good luck getting it all back into the original packaging lol. I bought an extra bag to carry the actual tent piece in, but still very worth it. I use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: All Appers Correct-No Direct Experience yet
customer_reviews.text: This tent was purchased for emergencies, so that to comment on long service life, I have to fall back on the experience of the friend who strongly recommended this brand. He has had years of experience in the outdoors with this product. My comments will be short and to the point. The package was opened, all parts were enclosed. The instructions were well laid out, and the tent was quickly erected. The quality of the materials appear to be as good as my friend had told me, and so, in this early going, all appears well.
customer_reviews.author: H. J. Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent
customer_reviews.text: Nice tent with lots of room. But in a heavy rain some moisture will come in.
customer_reviews.author: Vic68

customer_reviews.title: Looks like good quality. Light enough, for a tent for five. Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Not tried in rain yet. All around first look. Looks really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Scott

customer_reviews.title: Smart value!
customer_reviews.text: I've read some reviews on other inexpensive tents but chose this one. It is well worth it! My husband loves camping and has had many dome tents. This is his favorite! Good quality, well designed, weather proof. Use a sealer! Most people who complain about leaking tents forget or do not know that tents require a waterproofing sealer.
customer_reviews.author: Assisting Future Stars

customer_reviews.title: Camo Tent
customer_reviews.text: I will be hunting with my two children this year and needed a blind that will sit all 3 of us comfortably. After looking at all the other blinds out there I came accross this one and it will be great and cost less than smaller blinds! It does not have all the bells and whistles but cut a couple of slits in the windows and we were good to go. Lots of places to attach foliage to to help conceal it better. As a tent it works very well too.
customer_reviews.author: CPV

customer_reviews.title: Set up by myself was quick and easy per waterproof instructions sown into tent bag
customer_reviews.text: Set up by myself was quick and easy per waterproof instructions sown into tent bag. It's tall enough to stand up and get dressed. Plenty of Windows for ventilation and all the zippers worked well. Rain fly supports, tie downs and design work well and assembles quick. I'm more than Satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Tent is great. Easy to set up and plenty if room. You have to add a seem sealer but that is something I do with every tent I purchase. Overall for the money its hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Box did not have my did not have my rainfly
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tent and it did not come with the rainfly in the box now im suck with this outside and if it rains while im camping im screwed because the top of the tent is pure mesh without the rainfly im soo pissed
customer_reviews.author: David Moehlig

customer_reviews.title: The wife is happy, that is what counts most.
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well for us first time out. It is very roomy and well ventilated. Not a bit of condensation when others in my party were complaining about their tents. I bet some are looking at this one now.
customer_reviews.author: Blair E Frye

customer_reviews.title: Held up outside all summer
customer_reviews.text: I actually cut out the floor of this and put it in the woods over a stash of stuff in the woods. The zipper worked well 30 times in and out during 4 months last summer and nothing ripped or broke. Its not a heavy duty tent, nor is it a toy, but it is big inside and Camo.
customer_reviews.author: Rancher Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for price
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for the price. NOTE: secure the metal end caps to the fiberglass poles (duct tape, glue, etc.) prior to use. Lost one on the first weekend out. Recommend you purchase new tent pegs, use seam sealer on all seams and liquid soap on the zippers (lubrication), and you are set to go.
customer_reviews.author: N Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Have tent, will camp.
customer_reviews.text: The price and the size of this tent were excellen, but it is -9 degrees here in South Dakota and not the best weather to camp and test the tent just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Tudor

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent, instructions show a stake in center tabs ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice tent, instructions show a stake in center tabs at base of tent, no center tabs on tent, it needs center tabs, not sure if instructions are same for other tents or if they forgot center tabs on my tent, all in all it worked well, get some decent stakes don't bother with the flimsy stakes they supply. Worth the money, I used it during warm weather at a state militia JTX no rain or high winds, got a lot of compliments on it from other members of the militias. Roomy and good head hight, easy and fast to set up, I would recommend it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up for one person to manage
customer_reviews.text: This tent is badazz !!!! lots of room , plenty of height , and it breaths well in summertime. Worth every penny. Easy set up for one person to manage. AND it CAMO :)
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ditrich

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for the price. Very easy to set up. This tent will do the job it was meant to do. Nothing more, nothing less. No it won't keep you warm in the arctic but for 3 seasons it gets the job done for the price of a hotel room.
customer_reviews.author: Justsomeguy

customer_reviews.title: The first time we used this tent the loops that ...
customer_reviews.text: The first time we used this tent the loops that hold it till the ground ripped off of two if the corners after being staked down. The tent is very cheaply made and is junk. I'd give it less than one star if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Met expectations
customer_reviews.text: For the money, a good buy; one of the tie down loops came apart first set-up; other than thaty good overall tent.
customer_reviews.author: mark n. scott

customer_reviews.title: Camping
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son. He loves it and camped all over Southern Louisiana He came home with great story's.
customer_reviews.author: Coletta D. Kneiblher

customer_reviews.title: roomy,and windows zip shut.
customer_reviews.text: roomy,stakes way too cheap but tent stayed dry during downpour.it did not hold up to winds over 20 mph with the stakes.the tent fly flew off.i would recomend this tent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: D. jordan

customer_reviews.title: Good Tent
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good tent with a lot of room and good looks. I hope that it lasts for a long while.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Vance

customer_reviews.title: Great tent. Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.text: Used a couple times. Great tent. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: David Antonio Gil

customer_reviews.title: Nice little shelter
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little tent. The clips tend to break, however you can ask the Texsport people for replacements easy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: My Family and I love this tent. We first tried it in the backyard. LOTS of room. Now its going to the woods!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mommafish

product_meta.title: Texsport 5 Person Headquarters Camo Square Dome Family Camping Backpacking Tent
product_meta.description:
Headquarters Camouflage Square Dome Tent measuring 9’ x 9’ x 72” h. Sleeps up to five persons. 190T polyester taffeta walls and rainfly are 1000 mm polyurethane coated. 1/2 length four-peak rainfly. Tub-style rip-stop polyethylene floor. Two-pole, pin and ring frame system with shock-corded fiberglass poles. Durable speed clips and sleeves secure tent to frame. “No-see-um” mesh “D” style front door with zippered storm flap. “No-see-um” mesh rear and side windows with zippered storm flaps. Four “no-see-um” mesh roof panels. Lantern hook and mesh storage pocket. Complete with stakes, carry/storage bag

AMAZON.COM
A proper collection of camping gear begins with your tent, and this spacious model from Texsport offers a comfortable night's sleep for five campers, at a great value. 

 The Camouflage Headquarters tent measures nine-by-six-by-nine feet (W x H x D) and features easy set-up and take-down thanks to a two-pole, pin-and-ring frame system with shock-corded fiberglass poles and durable speed clips. Rugged taffeta material has a water-resistant polyurethane coating and is flame retardant to C.P.A.I.-84 specifications. 

 A D-style front door provides easy in-and-out, and its "no-see-um" mesh material, mesh rear and side windows with zippered storm flaps, four mesh roof panels, zippered storm flap, and half-length four-peak rainfly let you keep the elements at bay while enjoying sufficient airflow. A ripstop polyethylene, tub-style floor is water- and boot-proof, and additional convenient touches include a lantern hook and mesh storage pocket to keep small essentials organized. The tent comes complete with stakes and a convenient carrying and storage bag. 

 Warranty
This Texsport tent includes a limited three-year manufacturer's warranty against defects in materials and workmanship.
feature_bullets: Spacious five-person tent measures nine-by-six-by-nine feet (W x H x D)
Easy set-up and take-down thanks to two-pole, pin-and-ring frame system with shock-corded fiberglass poles and speed clips
D-style front door made of "no-see-um" mesh, mesh rear and side windows with zippered storm flaps, four mesh roof panels, zippered storm flap, and half-length four-peak rainfly
Taffeta material has water-resistant polyurethane coating and is flame retardant to C.P.A.I.-84 specifications; comes with stakes and convenient carrying and storage bag

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
